business.headline: 'Black Monday': US expert warns Trump tariffs could trigger worst crash since 1987Jim Cramer warned that markets might face a bloodbath similar to 1987 - when the Dow Jones suffered its biggest single-day crash to date. He claimed that if the US President didn't 'reach out' to nations which have not imposed retaliatory tariffs and reward them for their compliance, the situation could worsen.

Piyush Goyal announces helpline for startups days after 'dukandari' jibe at themDays after questioning the innovation of Indian startups overtly focussing on food delivery and betting and fantasy sports apps, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal announced a helpline for startups if they wanted to make suggestions or file complaints.

How China-US trade war unfolded: A timeline of tariffs and countermovesChina is responding forcefully to Trump's latest tariffs with a 34% tax on US imports, rare earth export curbs, company bans, and WTO action, raising fears of another full-blown trade war.

Jaguar Land Rover to suspend shipments to US over tariffs on BritainJaguar Land Rover, which is owned by India's Tata Motors, confirmed the temporary export suspension after the Times newspaper reported the plan.

JP Morgan warns of 60% chance of global recession after Trump's tariffsFollowing the US-China trade war, global investment firm J.P. Morgan said it now sees a 60% chance of the global economy entering recession by year-end, up from 40% previously.

Wall Street shatters as Trump tariffs trigger worst day in US markets since 2020US markets suffered their steepest decline since 2020 after China retaliated against Trump's tariffs. The S&P 500 fell 6%, fuelling recession fears and intensifying investor anxiety across global markets.

Dow crashes 2,000 points as Trump's tariffs spark global market panicGlobal markets plunged as Trump's tariffs triggered a trade war escalation with China. The Dow fell over 2,000 points, crude prices tumbled, and investors feared an impending global recession.

Higher inflation, slower growth: US Federal Reserve chair warns after Trump tariffsUS Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell spoke as global markets continued a swoon that has wiped some 10 per cent off major US stock indexes since Trump announced a raft of new tariffs on Wednesday.

US stocks plummet after China's retaliatory levies in response to Trump tariffsNasdaq IXIC dropped more than 20 per cent from its all-time closing high touched in December, putting it on course to confirm a bear market.
Income tax return 2025: ITR-2 filing now made easierITR-2 is meant for individuals whose annual income is above Rs 50 lakh or who earn from sources like rent, capital gains, or other sources.

Sensex tumbles over 900 points, Nifty ends below 23,000; IT, metal stocks crashThe S&P BSE Sensex tumbled 930.67 points to 75,364.69 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.65 points to settle at 22,904.45.

IT stocks bleed as market crashes. Why TCS, Infosys, Wipro shares are down?All major IT stocks declined as fears of a US recession led to heavy selling. IT companies earn a large portion of their revenue from the US market, and concerns about a slowdown in technology spending have further weakened investor sentiment.

With 'fancy ice-cream' jab, Piyush Goyal's cold message to Shark Tank judgesPiyush Goyal row: While flagging the trend of Indian startups focusing on 'fancy ice creams' and food delivery apps, Piyush Goyal drew a parallel with China to pitch for more innovation in deep-tech.

RIL share price falls 4% ahead of Q4 results. Should you sell?Reliance Industries stock: RIL shares opened at Rs 1,240 and fell to an intraday low of Rs 1,192.85 in the afternoon session. The stock was close to its 52-week low of Rs 1,156, which it touched on March 3, 2025.

US tariffs stay at 26% as White House unveils new trade documentInitially, India's tariff rate was mentioned as 27% in the earlier version of the White House annex. However, the latest revision has adjusted it to 26%.

Withdrawing EPF? Know rules for marriage, education, home and medical needsIf you require money out of your EPF for the purposes of marriage or further studies, there are set regulations one needs to adhere to. You must have been an EPF member for at least seven years and must have at least Rs 1,000 in your EPF account.

Politicians need reality check, says Ashneer Grover on Piyush Goyal's startup remarkAshneer Grover has said that Indian politicians need a reality check after Piyush Goyal criticised startups for being too focused on food delivery apps.

Pension rules updates: 8 RBI guidelines every pensioner must knowIf a bank accidentally credits more pension than it should to a pensioner, then the bank must consult the Pension Sanctioning Authority before recovering the extra money.
Explained: Why Tata Motors share price has fallen 5% todayTata Motors share price: Tata Motors has gone down 8.68% in the last 5 days, 33.43% in the past month and 38.75% in the last year.

Piyush Goyal slams Indian startups, urges to shift focus from food delivery appsUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal criticised India's startup ecosystem, saying it's too focused on food delivery, betting, and fantasy sports apps. In contrast, he praised Chinese startups for prioritising advanced tech like EVs, batteries, semiconductors, and AI, urging Indian innovators to shift toward deeper, tech-driven innovation.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points: 3 reasons behind today's stock market bloodbathStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 965.90 points to 75,329.46, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 361.10 points to 22,889.00 as of 2:08 pm.

Storm of protest from startups after Minister Piyush Goyal's 'dukaandari' jibeStartup ecosystem leaders' response came after Piyush Goyal took a firm stance and said that while Indian startups were busy building food delivery platforms and fantasy gaming apps, those in countries like China were working on EVs, semiconductors, batteries, and AI.

Sensex tanks over 700 points as Wall Street bloodbath sinks Indian IT stocksStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 698.89 points to 75,596.47 at around 10:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 269.50 points lower at 22,980.60.

Trump's tariff jitters hit US stocks: Will Sensex, Nifty feel the heat today?The extensive tariff announcements by the US government have raised concerns about a global recession, leading to sharp losses in stock markets worldwide.

Stocks to watch on April 4: Shares in news; HDFC Bank, Zomato, DMartStocks in news today: In Friday's session, shares of Zomato, Nestle India, HDFC Bank, DMart, Mazagon Dock, Bajaj Finance, and others will be in focus due to key corporate developments and financial updates.

Dukaandari hi karni hai? Piyush Goyal slams startups stuck on food deliveryCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal asked Indian startups to shift their focus from food delivery apps to high-tech sectors like semiconductors and AI.

Trump tariff blitz wrecks Wall Street, markets suffer biggest fall since CovidTrump's sweeping tariffs sent shockwaves through financial markets, with Wall Street suffering its worst decline since 2020. Analysts warn of economic slowdowns, surging inflation, and a potential recession.

US tech, retail stocks lead rout after Trump's tariff blowTrump's broad tariffs send US markets into a tailspin, with tech, retail, and banking stocks plunging. Apple, Walmart, and Nike face rising costs, while energy prices drop amid economic concerns.

Wall Street opens sharply lower amid trade war fears after Trump tariffsWall Street's major indexes fell sharply after President Trump's new tariffs raised trade war fears. The Dow dropped 2.66%, the S&P 500 declined 3.32%, and the Nasdaq plunged 4.50%, reflecting market uncertainty.

Wall Street bleeds as Trump's tariffs stoke recession fears: 3 things to knowThe Dow Jones Industrial Index fell sharply by over 1,100 points, while the Nasdaq was down over 800 points moments after the US markets opened for trading.

PPF nomination updation now free, says Nirmala SitharamanIt is important to add a nominee to the PPFaccount so that the money is transferred in a smooth manner in the event of the death of the PPF account holder.

Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff: India at 27%, but where does Pakistan stand?Asian nations have been the hardest hit by Trump's latest tariff move. The new duties aim to cut the US trade deficit and change global supply chains.
Sensex, Nifty snap 2-day winning streak as D-Street sees limited tariff impactThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 322.08 points to close at 76,295.36, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 82.25 points to end at 23,250.10.
Explained: How Trump's administration calculated reciprocal tariffsIn a statement released on Wednesday night, the United States Trade Representative (USTR) explained how the tariffs were determined.

Byju Raveendran alleges conspiracy caught on video amid legal woesThe video he shared is one minute and 44 seconds long and appears to be a screen recording of a virtual meeting involving Byju's shareholders and their lawyers.

Trump's tariff list: Here's why Asian countries took the biggest hitTrump tariff: Besides China, which now faces a total tariff of 54%, Vietnam has been hit with 46%, Thailand with 37%, South Korea with 25%, and India with 27%.

Trump's tariff order: India gets key exemptions on several critical mineralsTrump's new tariff order exempts India on copper, lumber, and critical minerals. The order imposes a 26% lower tariff on India compared to China, but experts question the calculation methods. Former diplomat Ashok Sajjanar criticises the non-transparent system and highlights the impact on strategic partnerships in the Indo-Pacific region.

Mixed bag, not a setback: India's first response to Trump's tariffThe Commerce Ministry of India is analysing the impact of the 27% tariff imposed by the US. The ministry states it's a mixed bag and not a setback. Exemptions are expected in sectors like pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and critical minerals. The tariff ranges from 10% to 27% across various sectors. India aims to sign a Bilateral Trade Agreement with the US by fall this year.

Sun Pharma, Gland, Cipla, Dr Reddy's: Why pharma stocks are rising todayShares of Sun Pharma, Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Gland Pharma, and Cipla rose sharply during early trade, defying the weak trend visible on the broader markets.
Trump tariffs roil Dalal Street: Sensex, Nifty fall as IT stocks worst hitThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 344.27 points to 76,273.17, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 80.60 points to 23,251.75 as of 9:31 am.

entertainment.headline: Diljit Dosanjh, Will Smith groove to dhol beats. Fans call it ultimate collabDiljit Dosanjh surprised fans with a viral Instagram video featuring Will Smith. The duo was seen enjoying a vibrant Bhangra dance, sparking excitement online.

Hugh Grant criticises Heathrow officer for 'creepy' questions with his children. Fans reactActor Hugh Grant expressed his discontent on social media after a Heathrow immigration officer's comments to his children. The incident has divided opinions online, with many defending the officer's actions.

Miss Mary: The Meena Kumari-Kishore Kumar classic that captured age of innocenceIn this week's Retro Review, we revisit 'Miss Mary', starring Meena Kumari, Gemini Ganesan and Kishore Kumar. Perhaps one of India's most remade films, the comedy movie still remains a classic six decades later.

Sidharth Malhotra, Saif Ali Khan in talks for Race 4: Producer Ramesh TauraniProducer Ramesh Taurani clarified the casting rumors surrounding Race 4. He mentioned that only Saif Ali Khan and Sidharth Malhotra are currently in talks for the film.

Top 10 teen shows to watch on Netflix in April 2025Netflix's April 2025 lineup features ten top-rated teen shows, blending romance, drama, comedy, and fantasy. Highlights include Heartstopper, Stranger Things, Never Have I Ever, and Teenage Bounty Hunters.

Burqa City director 'surprised' by similarity with Laapataa Ladies' plotFrench director Fabrice Bracq accused Kiran Rao's Laapataa Ladies of plagiarising his short film Burqa City. The controversy has sparked a debate on originality and creative influence.

Laapataa Ladies writer Biplab Goswami denies plagiarism claims: Completely untrueBiplab Goswami, screenwriter of Laapataa Ladies, denied plagiarism allegations following online comparisons to Burqa City. He asserted the film's originality, citing years of research and screenplay registration since 2014.

Hrithik Roshan calls Jr NTR his favourite co-star: He's brilliant and amazingHrithik Roshan, during his Tour marking 25 years in Bollywood, called Jr NTR his favourite co-star. He also spoke about directing Krrish 4 and his desire to work with Christopher Nolan.

Mugdha Chaphekar, Ravish Desai announce separation after 9 years of marriageTV actors Mugdha Chaphekar and Ravish Desai have announced their separation after nine years of marriage. They have been living apart for over a year.

Travis Scott India Tour: Second show added in Delhi due to high demandTravis Scott is set to perform in India for the first time with his Circus Maximus Tour on October 18, 2025. Owing to a huge demand, a second show has also been added.
Chhaava on OTT: When and where to watch Vicky Kaushal's blockbuster filmVicky Kaushal's blockbuster Chhaava is gearing up for its digital release on Netflix, expected on April 11.

RRR stars Ram Charan, Jr NTR to reunite with director Rajamouli, but not for filmRam Charan and Jr NTR, stars of the blockbuster RRR, will join director SS Rajamouli and composer MM Keeravaani for a special Q&A session at London's Royal Albert Hall.

Teary-eyed Amitabh Bachchan attends Manoj Kumar's funeral with son AbhishekVeteran actor Manoj Kumar's last rites are being conducted in Juhu, Mumbai, with several celebrities, including Amitabh Bachchan, present to pay their respects.

Empuraan box office Day 9: Mohanlal film becomes highest-grossing Malayalam filmL2 Empuraan continues its impressive box office run, earning Rs 2.9 crore on its ninth day. With a total of Rs 91.15 crore in India and strong overseas earnings, it may become the highest-grossing Malayalam film.

Echoes of the past: Lost charm of Bollywood music, can the glory days be back?It has been a while since the Hindi film industry produced a full album which boasted some memorable tracks. So does this mean Bollywood music has lost its sheen? Artistes such as Lalit Pandit and Shabana Azmi weigh in.

Veteran actor Manoj Kumar to be cremated with state honours in MumbaiVeteran actor Manoj Kumar, known for his patriotic films, will be given a state funeral. The Bollywood fraternity and his family are set to bid him a final farewell, with his last rites scheduled in Juhu at 11:30 am.

Sikandar box office Day 6: Salman Khan film struggles, earns mere Rs 3.75 croreSalman Khan's latest film Sikandar, directed by AR Murugadoss, saw a significant drop at the box office on its sixth day despite a decent start. The film's total domestic collection now stands at Rs 94 crore after earning just Rs 3.75 crore on Day 6.
75 crore on Friday

Jr NTR praises brother-in-law Nithin at MAD Square success bashMAD Square has been a hit among audiences, and Jr NTR couldn't be prouder of his brother-in-law Narne Nithin's acting journey. Speaking at the success bash on Friday, he reminisced about his initial reaction when Nithin first approached him to discuss his aspirations of becoming an actor.
The Last Five Years finally hits Broadway after years of anticipationNick Jonas and Adrienne Warren bring the beloved musical 'The Last Five Years' to Broadway for the first time.

general news.headline: UK Prime Minister to declare end of globalisation amid Trump's trade warThe UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is all set to announce that globalisation - which began with the fall of the Soviet Union in 1991 - has caused disappointment to millions of voters as Trump's unprecedented 10 per cent 'baseline' tariffs slipped the global markets into uncertainty.

PM Modi to inaugurate India's first vertical lift sea bridge today in Tamil NaduRooted in mythology, Pamban Bridge holds deep spiritual significance, as the Ramayana recounts the construction of Ram Setu beginning from Dhanushkodi, near Rameswaram.

Bride-to-be, 24, dies after fall from roller coaster at Delhi amusement parkPriyanka, a sales manager from Chanakyapuri, was at Fun and Food Village near the Kapashera border with her future husband, Nikhil, on Wednesday afternoon, when the incident happened.

Kerala employee made to crawl like dog for failing targets, viral video showsA video showing a man being tied with a leash around his neck and forced to walk on his knees by a man who did not fulfill his targets at a private marketing firm went viral. The Kerala Labour Department ordered a probe into the matter.
Does being in a happy relationship really make you gain weight?Experts explain that having a healthy relationship at times leads to one's weight gain, but it varies with everyone too.

He claimed that if the US President didn't 'reach out' to nations which have not imposed retaliatory tariffs and reward them for their compliance, the situation could worsen.

Video: Woman, 20, collapses and dies while giving farewell speech in collegeThe video circulating online shows Varsha laughing and addressing the gathering moments before she loses consciousness and collapses.

Kunal Kamra's letter to Mumbai Police after skipping third summon in Shinde rowKunal Kamra sparked a massive row after a clip from his stand-up show went viral on social media where he made a joke at Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde and referred to him as a 'traitor'.

'Hands Off!' protests: Thousands unite across US to oppose Trump and Musk's policiesThe Hands Off! protests are a series of demonstrations organized to express dissatisfaction with the Trump administration's policies, particularly federal layoffs, mass deportations, and other controversial actions.

University of Bath School of Management: A Pathway to Global Career SuccessBath's School of Management blends top academics, hands-on learning, and career support to help students secure jobs at leading global companies.

Karnataka High Court bats for Uniform Civil Code: Will give justice to all womenThe court emphasised that personal laws based on religion often result in unequal treatment of citizens-particularly women-despite their equal status under the Indian Constitution.

2 British MPs detained over 'anti-Israel activities', UK says unacceptableTwo British MPs, part of a parliamentary delegation, have been detained by Israeli authorities as they were suspected of plans to "document the activities of security forces and spread anti-Israel hatred".

Miss Mary: The Meena Kumari-Kishore Kumar classic that captured age of innocenceIn this week's Retro Review, we revisit 'Miss Mary', starring Meena Kumari, Gemini Ganesan and Kishore Kumar. Perhaps one of India's most remade films, the comedy movie still remains a classic six decades later.

No hostile use of our land against India, Sri Lanka President tells PM; pacts inkedPrime Minister Narendra Modi, in Sri Lanka for a three-day visit, held extensive talks with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and reiterated their commitment to work together in realising the joint vision for 'Fostering Partnerships for a Shared Future'.

PM Modi meets Sri Lanka's 1996 World Cup heroes in ColomboPrime Minister Narendra Modi met with Sri Lanka's 1996 World Cup heroes in Colombo on Saturday, April 5. PM Modi had a chat with some of the stars from the iconic side that defeated Australia to win the title.

MS Dhoni should have retired after IPL 2023, he is losing respect: Manoj TiwaryManoj Tiwary feels that MS Dhoni should have retired after the IPL 2023 title win and claimed that the CSK legend is slowly starting to lose the respect of the fans. Dhoni has struggled to make an impact this season.

Delhi-NCR to sizzle at 42°C, heatwave warning issued for next six daysStates likely to be impacted by the heatwave include Delhi, south Haryana, west Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Gujarat, Rajasthan, and west Madhya Pradesh. Daytime temperatures in these regions could rise by 2–4°C during the period.

Piyush Goyal announces helpline for startups days after 'dukandari' jibe at themDays after questioning the innovation of Indian startups overtly focussing on food delivery and betting and fantasy sports apps, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal announced a helpline for startups if they wanted to make suggestions or file complaints.

Ghibli AI art vs real hand-drawn magic: Can tech match the heart of the originals?The Ghibli AI art trend has gone viral with people gushing over its lively creation and vibrant style, but fans of the original studio say it lacks soul. Can an AI-made filter really capture decades of emotional, hand-drawn animation? Where do we draw the line in honouring Ghibli's timeless artistry?

SRH vs GT: Shubman Gill and Ishan Kishan hilariously rate 'batter' Mohammed SirajAhead of GT and SRH's Hyderabad showdown, close friends Ishan Kishan and Shubman Gill shared a light-hearted moment hyping up Mohammed Siraj's batting in the nets.

Odisha man accuses wife of mental torture in video, then jumps in front of trainMoments after recording the message, Ramchandra reportedly jumped in front of a moving train near a railway track and died on the spot.

sports.headline: Siraj has been exceptional, don't be quick to judge: Vikram SolankiIPL 2025, SRH vs GT: Director of Cricket Operations at Gujarat Titans, Vikram Solanki, praised Mohammed Siraj for being exceptional for the team. Siraj won the Player of the Match award against the Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Although Ashutosh was dismissed for 1 against CSK, he has been key to DC's success in 
IPL 2025.

CSK's identity crisis could turn MS Dhoni into the villainIPL 2025: MS Dhoni wasn't meant to carry CSK in IPL 2025. He planned and trained to just finish with a flourish. But a timid, unrecognisable CSK now risks rewriting his farewell as a fall from grace.

Rattled CSK not even trying: Wasim Jaffer on major concern after DC defeatIPL 2025: Former batter Wasim Jaffer was surprised by the Chennai Super Kings' (CSK) batting approach after their 25-run defeat to Axar Patel's Delhi Capitals (DC) on Saturday at Chepauk.

Maxwell like Halley's Comet of Cricket, scores once in 75 games: ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar didn't hold back while critiquing Glenn Maxwell's IPL form, comparing his rare batting success to Halley's Comet. As Punjab Kings falter, questions loom large over Maxwell's impact with the bat despite occasional breakthroughs with the ball.

With the England pacer showing signs of returning to his former self, a transitioning Rajasthan side can slowly start dreaming of a fantastic campaign.

Jofra Archer breathes fire again in IPL: RR pacer reveals mantra to successIPL 2025, PBKS vs RR: Fast bowler Jofra Archer won the Player of the Match award in Rajasthan's 50-run win over Punjab on Saturday. The express pacer took three wickets, including two in in his first over.

Sanju Samson claims RR have finally found their 'pattern' after PBKS winRajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson feels that his side has finally found their right combination after thrashing Punjab Kings by 50 runs on Saturday, April 5. Royals made it two out of two wins in IPL 2025.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
